page.title: 20SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Living at Stourmouth is attended by {certain drawbacks}that might seem strange to town dwellers. There is no main drainage, so that every house has to have a{cesspit.}This is due to the village being almost at Sea-Level. No {piped gas,}and problems with water supply so that you have to count baths.{Bus services}are more or less non-existent. There is a school bus going to Canterbury at 7.45 am with return trips at 4.45 and 5.45 pm. Just taking her cat to the vet in Ash costs one old lady Â£9.00 in taxi fares. Some friction between villagers and Farmers is caused by mud being brought onto the roads by tractors. Kids cannot use bikes and cars skid, but farmers do not seem to care and will not wash tractors down.
